style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:8pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:110%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;">If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a)&#160;of the Exchange Act. </span><span style="font-family:Arial Unicode MS;font-size:8pt;">&#9744;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;-sec-extract:summary;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:17%;"></td><td style="width:19%;"></td><td style="width:19%;"></td><td style="width:19%;"></td><td style="width:26%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.02. Results of Operations and Financial Condition</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;30, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Comcast Corporation (&#8220;Comcast&#8221;) issued a press release reporting the results of its operations for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and six</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The press release is attached hereto as Exhibit 99.1. Exhibit 99.2 sets forth the reasons Comcast believes that presentation of the non-GAAP financial measures contained in the press release provides useful information to investors regarding Comcast's results of operations and financial condition. To the extent material, Exhibit 99.2 also discloses the additional purposes, if any, for which Comcast's management uses these non-GAAP financial measures.&#160; A reconciliation of these non-GAAP financial measures with the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures is included in the press release itself.  Comcast does not intend for this Item 2.02 or Exhibit 99.1 or Exhibit 99.2 to be treated as "filed" under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or incorporated by reference into its filings under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9.01. Exhibits</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><img src="comcastlogo2a02.jpg" alt="comcastlogo2a02.jpg" style="height:62px;width:160px;"><font #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">PRESS RELEASE</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">COMCAST REPORTS </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">2nd QUARTER</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">PHILADELPHIA - </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8230;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) today reported results for the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8220;Our response to COVID-19 has been extraordinarily fast and effective, and our products and brands continue to resonate strongly with our customers across all segments and all geographies. The solid results that we delivered in the quarter highlight the resilience of our company. Cable delivered record second quarter customer relationship net adds, driven by the best second quarter high-speed internet net adds in 13 years. NBCUniversal successfully launched Peacock in Cable&#8217;s footprint in April, ahead of the streaming service&#8217;s U.S. nationwide launch earlier this month, with 10 million sign-ups to date. NBCUniversal also just recently announced a deal with AMC Theatres in the U.S. that allows Universal to release titles across PVOD platforms after a 17-day exclusive theatrical window. At Sky, our flexible strategy helped retain customers until key sports returned in May and June. Overall, based on our results and the many organic growth opportunities that we have across our company, I am confident in our ability to continue to successfully navigate the impact of COVID-19, and emerge from the crisis even stronger. I could not be more proud of how our teams across Comcast Cable, NBCUniversal and Sky are together managing the business,"</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;commented Brian L. Roberts, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Comcast Corporation.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue</font><font Comcast</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$3.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">12.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$3.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$7.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Net income attributable to Comcast decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">23.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$5.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Adjusted Net Income decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$6.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$16.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Earnings per Share (EPS)</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EPS</font><font Adjusted EPS decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.40</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Capital Expenditures</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Cable Communications&#8217; capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. NBCUniversal&#8217;s capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">20.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$375 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Sky's capital expenditures increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">22.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$215 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$4.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Cable Communications' capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. NBCUniversal's capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">18.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$752 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Sky's capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$412 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net Cash Provided by Operating Activities </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$8.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Free Cash Flow</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$6.0</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;billion. These results reflect reduced tax payments in the second quarter of 2020 due to the extension of due dates for federal estimated tax payments to the third quarter of 2020.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, net cash provided by operating activities was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$14.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. These results reflect reduced tax payments in the second quarter of 2020 due to the extension of due dates for federal estimated tax payments to the third quarter of 2020.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Dividends </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">paid during the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;totaled </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:6px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">2</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for Cable Communications of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$14.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was consistent with the prior year period, reflecting increases in high-speed internet, wireless and business services revenue, offset by decreases in video, advertising, voice and other revenue. These results were negatively impacted by COVID-19, including accrued customer regional sports network (RSN) fee adjustments, reduced advertising revenue, lower revenue due to Xfinity's commitment to the FCC's Keep Americans Connected Pledge and our efforts to assist our customers during this crisis. High-speed internet revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting an increase in the number of residential high-speed internet customers and an increase in average rates. Average rates would have been higher if it were not for waived fees due to COVID-19 and the impacts of the customer RSN fee adjustments. Wireless revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">33.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting an increase in the number of customer lines. Business services revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting an increase in the number of customers receiving our services compared to the prior year period and increases in average rates. The rates of growth were reduced due to the negative impacts of COVID-19 on small businesses. Video revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting a decrease in the number of residential video customers, partially offset by an increase in average rates. Average rates were negatively impacted by the impacts of the customer RSN fee adjustments, partially offset by higher pay-per-view revenue. Advertising revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">29.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting reduced advertiser spending due to COVID-19, partially offset by an increase in political advertising revenue. Voice revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to decreases in average rates and in the number of residential voice customers. Other revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">11.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue due to waived late fees and a decline in revenue associated with our security and automation services, partially offset by an increase in revenue from licensing our X1 and technology platforms. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:7pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, Cable revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$29.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven by growth in high-speed internet, business services and wireless revenue, partially offset by a decrease in voice, advertising, video and other revenue. These results were negatively impacted by COVID-19, including accrued customer RSN fee adjustments, reduced advertising revenue, lower revenue due to Xfinity's commitment to the FCC's Keep Americans Connected Pledge and our efforts to assist our customers during this crisis.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:7pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total Customer Relationships </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">increased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">217,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">32.1</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Residential customer relationships increased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">241,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and business customer relationships decreased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">24,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Total high-speed internet customer net additions were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">323,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, which does not include over 600,000 additional high-risk or free Internet Essentials customers that still receive our service, but were not included in reported results. Total video customer net losses were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">477,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and total voice customer net losses were </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">158,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. In addition, Cable Communications added </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">126,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;wireless lines in the quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">29,750</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">28,508</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">241</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">3</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for Cable Communications increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$6.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting revenue that was consistent with the prior year period as well as a </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">4.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decrease in operating expenses. Total operating expenses benefited from adjustments for provisions in our programming distribution agreements with RSNs related to canceled sporting events as a result of COVID-19. Programming costs decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to the adjustment provisions. Excluding these adjustments, programming costs increased due to higher retransmission consent and sports programming fees, partially offset by a decline in the number of video subscribers. Non-programming expenses decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting lower advertising, marketing and promotion expenses, other operating expenses and customer service expenses, partially offset by higher technical and product support expenses. Non-programming expenses per customer relationship decreased 7.1%. Non-programming expenses included additional compensation costs for certain personnel and increases in administrative and bad debt expenses as a result of COVID-19, that were more than offset by cost saving initiatives and a reduction in activity in some aspects of our business. Adjusted EBITDA per customer relationship increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, and Adjusted EBITDA margin was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">42.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">40.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. While the accrued RSN adjustments did not impact Adjusted EBITDA in the second quarter of 2020, they resulted in an increase to Adjusted EBITDA margin. Cable Communications results include a loss of $37 million from our wireless business, compared to a loss of $88 million in the prior year period.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, Cable Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$12.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting higher revenue and flat expenses. Programming costs decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;primarily due to adjustments for provisions in our programming distribution agreements with RSNs related to canceled sporting events as a result of COVID-19. Excluding these adjustments,</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:7pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">programming costs increased due to an increase in retransmission consent and sports programming fees, partially offset by a decline in the number of video subscribers. Non-programming expenses increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">0.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting higher costs as a result of COVID-19, partially offset by cost savings initiatives. For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, Adjusted EBITDA per customer relationship increased 1.8%, and Adjusted EBITDA margin was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">41.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">40.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. While the accrued RSN adjustments did not impact Adjusted EBITDA for the six months ended June 30, 2020, they resulted in an increase to Adjusted EBITDA margin. Cable Communications results include a loss of $96 million from our wireless business, compared to a loss of $191 million in the prior year period.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Capital Expenditures </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for Cable Communications decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting decreased investment in customer premise equipment, partially offset by increased investment in scalable infrastructure. Cable capital expenditures represented </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of Cable revenue in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">11.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in last year's </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, Cable capital expenditures decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting decreased investment in customer premise equipment, partially offset by increased investment in scalable infrastructure. Cable capital expenditures represented </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of Cable revenue compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10.3%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:7pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:7pt;"><br></font></div><div style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for NBCUniversal decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">25.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$6.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">29.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, NBCUniversal revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">16.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$13.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to last year's results. Adjusted EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">27.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$3.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Cable Networks</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Cable Networks revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">14.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower distribution revenue and advertising revenue, partially offset by higher content licensing and other revenue. Distribution revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">14.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting credits accrued at some of our RSNs resulting from the reduced number of games planned by professional sports leagues due to COVID-19 and a decline in subscribers, partially offset by contractual rate increases. Advertising revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">27.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to reduced spending from advertisers as a result of COVID-19, including from the postponement or cancellation of sporting events, and continued ratings declines at our networks. Content licensing and other revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">23.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to the timing of content provided under licensing agreements, including transactions with Peacock in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue that was more than offset by lower operating costs. The decrease in operating costs was driven by lower programming and production expenses, primarily reflecting the postponement or cancellation of sporting events due to COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, revenue from the Cable Networks segment decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$5.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower distribution and advertising revenue, partially offset by higher content licensing and other revenue. Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to 2019, reflecting lower revenue, more than offset by lower operating costs. The decrease in operating costs was driven by lower programming and production costs, primarily reflecting the postponement or cancellation of sporting events due to COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Broadcast Television</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Broadcast Television revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower advertising revenue, partially offset by higher content licensing revenue and distribution and other revenue. Advertising revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">27.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to reduced spending from advertisers as a result of COVID-19, including from the postponement or cancellation of sporting events, and continued ratings declines. Content licensing revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">58.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to the timing of content provided under licensing agreements, including transactions with Peacock in the second quarter of 2020. Distribution and other revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">9.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to higher retransmission consent fees. Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">20.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$641 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue more than offset by lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, revenue from the Broadcast Television segment increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">3.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$5.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting an increase in content licensing and distribution and other revenue, partially offset by a decrease in advertising revenue.</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ff0000;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">24.0%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting higher revenue and lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Filmed Entertainment</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Filmed Entertainment revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">18.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting lower theatrical revenue and other revenue, partially offset by higher content licensing revenue. Theatrical revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">96.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting theater closures as a result of COVID-19 and the strong performances of films in the prior year period, including </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">The Secret Life of Pets 2</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Other revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">59.6%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to decreases in revenue from our movie ticketing, entertainment and live stage play businesses, which were impacted by theater and entertainment venue closures as a result of COVID-19.</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Content licensing revenue increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">19.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven by the performance of certain 2020 releases that were made available on premium video on demand, including </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Trolls World Tour </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">and </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">The King of Staten Island,</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as well as the timing of when content was made available under licensing agreements, including transactions with Peacock in the second quarter of 2020. Adjusted EBITDA increased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">24.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$228 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue that was more than offset by lower operating costs. The decrease in operating costs was primarily driven by lower advertising, marketing and promotion expenses due to lower spending on current period releases as a result of COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, revenue from the Filmed Entertainment segment decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">20.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting lower theatrical revenue and other revenue. Adjusted </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">5</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">EBITDA decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">38.8%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$334 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue, partially offset by lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Theme Parks</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Theme Parks revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">94.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$87 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to the temporary closures of our theme parks as a result of COVID-19. Universal Orlando Resort and Universal Studios Japan reopened with limited capacity in June, while Universal Studios Hollywood remains closed. Theme Parks Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$399 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue, partially offset by lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, revenue from the Theme Parks segment decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">65.1%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$956 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to the temporary closures of Universal Studios Japan in late February and Universal Orlando Resort and Universal Studios Hollywood in mid-March as a result of COVID-19. Theme Parks Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$323 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower revenue, partially offset by lower operating costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Headquarters, Other and Eliminations</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">NBCUniversal Headquarters, Other and Eliminations include overhead and eliminations among the NBCUniversal businesses. For the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, NBCUniversal Headquarters, Other and Eliminations Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$75 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, compared to a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$184 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, NBCUniversal Headquarters, Other and Eliminations Adjusted EBITDA loss was </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$259 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to a loss of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$358 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Sky</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="5"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="width:20%;"></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#d9d9d6;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">for Sky decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">15.5%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$4.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Excluding the impact of currency, revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">12.9%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, driven by lower direct-to-consumer revenue, advertising revenue and content revenue. Direct-to-consumer revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$3.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily reflecting a decrease in average revenue per customer relationship, driven by the impacts of COVID-19, which resulted in lower sports subscription revenues, as well as decreases in customers receiving our services. Advertising revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">41.2%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$321 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, primarily due to overall market weakness, which was worsened by COVID-19, as well as an unfavorable impact from a change in legislation related to gambling advertisements in the UK and Italy. Content revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">35.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$234 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, due to lower revenue from sports programming as a result of the postponement of sporting events due to COVID-19. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, Sky revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10.7%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$8.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. Excluding the impact of currency, revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">8.4%</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting lower direct-to-consumer, advertising and content revenue.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">6</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Total Customer Relationships </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">decreased by </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">214,000</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">23.7 million</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, reflecting the postponement of sporting events and the suspension of certain sales channels due to COVID-19. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New
